contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox radio station | name = XHAVO | image = | city = [[Reynosa, Tamaulipas]] | area = [[McAllen, Texas]], [[USA]]/Reynosa, [[Mexico]] | branding = Digital | slogan = | airdate = | frequency = 101.5 [[Megahertz|MHz]] | format = [[Contemporary hit radio|Spanish & English Top 40 (CHR)]] | power = 50,000 [[watt]]s | erp = | haat = 150 meters | class = B | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = [[BMP Radio]] | sister_stations = [[KBUC]], [[KESO]]/[[XHRR-FM|XHRR]], [[KJAV]], [[KSOX]], [[KZSP]], [[XHCAO-FM|XHCAO]] | webcast = [http://den-a.plr.liquidcompass.net/cust/XHAVOFM/audio_player.php?id=XHAVOFM Listen Live] | website = [http://www.clubdigital1015.com/ www.clubdigital1015.com] | affiliations = }} '''XHAVO''' (branded as Digital) is a [[Contemporary hit radio|Spanish & English Top 40 (CHR)]] [[radio station]] that serves the [[McAllen, Texas]] (USA) / [[Reynosa, Tamaulipas]] (Mexico) border area. ==External links== * [http://www.clubdigital1015.com/ Official website] * [http://radiostationworld.com/Locations/United_States_of_America/Texas/radio.asp?m=rio raiostationworld.com; Radio stations serving the Rio Grande Valley] * [http://www.mexicoradiotv.com/tamaulipas/index.htm mexicoradiotv.com; List of Tamaulipas radio / television stations] {{Reynosa Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Spanish-language radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations in Reynosa]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
